channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: AdGuard’s New Filtering Engine Catches a Lot More Ads
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Another update for the AdGuard extension.
item.content:encoded: AdGuard has just released extension v5.2.77, and this marks the first time the 5.2 version has been made available to the public. It has a completely redesigned interface and an overhaul of how the extension handles filtering.

item.title: I Thought Google Photos Ruined the Editor, But it Won Me Over
item.dc:creator: Aran Folsom
item.description: A bad first impression, but I get it now.
item.content:encoded: This year marked Google Photos' 10th birthday, and to celebrate, a redesign was announced. The most noticeable changes appeared in the editor, and after initially being very against this change, it's really grown on me over time.

item.title: Is It Safe to Keep a Portable Battery in a Hot Car?
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: You probably should think twice about leaving that battery there.
item.content:encoded: People leave portable batteries in their cars for emergencies or to recharge their phones on the go. After all, a car seems like the perfect mobile storage unit, ready to shuttle our gadgets wherever we need them. However, this is a huge mistake that can cost you a lot of money.

item.title: Your Google TV Just Got a Lot Smarter
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: As generative AI rises and becomes commonplace in our lives, old-school voice assistants such as Google Assistant are the ones getting the boot. We've seen a widespread effort by Google to replace Assistant with Gemini—even as Gemini isn't quite yet capable of doing everything Assistant can, but that's an issue for another day. Now, your TV is next in that big step.

item.title: How to Enable Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling in Windows 10 and 11
item.dc:creator: Mahesh Makvana
Samir Makwana
Nick Lewis
item.description: Want to make your apps and games a bit smoother? Try this.
item.content:encoded: Windows 10 and Windows 11 come with an advanced setting, called Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling, which can boost gaming and video performance using your PC's GPU. We'll show you how to enable the feature, potentially get a performance increase, and ensure some of the best features available on modern GPUs work like they should.

item.title: Google Is Hoping to Fix Its Biggest Play Store Problem
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: And some welcomed changes to Google Play Games.
item.content:encoded: Considering it's owned by a company known for search, it’s notoriously difficult to find stuff in the Google Play Store. Google is rolling out a few changes that might make the whole experience a lot less painful.

item.title: 8 Essential Peaky Blinders Episodes to Watch Before The Immortal Man Movie
item.dc:creator: Keeley Brooks
item.category: The Immortal Man: A Peaky Blinders Film
item.description: Witness the rise and fall of the Shelby crime family as they navigate betrayals, rivalries, and personal tragedies in this gritty drama.
item.content:encoded: Peaky Blinders is the most popular Netflix series to ferociously capture audience attention and keep it, uninterrupted, for six whole seasons. It’s one of my favorite shows, even if I do have to watch it with subtitles on. The hit series ended its run in 2022, leaving an aching void in the hearts of viewers everywhere. To our surprise, that chasm filled with joy when creator Stephen Knight and Netflix announced that a sequel feature film is on the way.

item.title: The Luxury Compact Sports Sedan That’s Become a Used-Car Steal
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: This refined performance sedan delivers big thrills and upscale comfort for a bargain price on the used market.
item.content:encoded: Looking for a premium driving experience without paying a premium price? The used market is brimming with opportunities, but one luxury compact sports sedan stands out as a true bargain. Once priced to compete with the most coveted European rivals, it now delivers high-end performance and refinement for thousands less than many mainstream new cars.

item.title: The PlayStation 5 Is Great for Physical Media, With This One Exception
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: The Xbox Series X can do it, why not PlayStation?
item.content:encoded: Sony’s PlayStation consoles have been a great way to watch movies and TV shows on discs, and they even helped popularize the DVD and Blu-ray formats. The PlayStation 5 is carrying on that tradition, with one curious exception: you can’t play an audio CD.

item.title: How and Why I Run 4 Operating Systems on My PC
item.dc:creator: Dibakar Ghosh
item.description: Welcome to the world of multi-boot PCs.
item.content:encoded: Are you someone like me whose entire life revolves around their desktop PCs? Do you work, study, game, and watch movies all from a single computer? If yes, having separate OSes for each of your workflows might help you become more organized and productive. Here’s a complete breakdown of how I benefit from running a quad-boot PC.
